g2:Structure.g2:sa.ATTRIBUTE-INITIAL-VALUE: print means print-to-server in configurations, inconsistent behavior of move in configurations, extra vertices in g2-get-connection-vertices

configure the user interface as follows: when in system-administrator or developer mode: pressing alt+the right mouse button implies show-class-definition; when in system-administrator, developer, or modeler mode: pressing control+the right mouse button on any object implies go-to-subworkspace; pressing control+the right mouse button on any kb-workspace implies hide-workspace; pressing shift+the right mouse button on any kb-workspace implies go-to-superior; unless in administrator mode: attributes visible for kb-restrictions exclude: main-menu-user-restrictions, keyboard-command-restrictions, initial-g2-user-mode-for-this-kb; pressing the left mouse button on any bpr-annotation starts grtl-track-mouse-over-message as the mouse tracks continuously over any bpr-annotation; pressing the right mouse button on any _gxl-cell starts grtl-track-mouse-over-message as the mouse tracks continuously over any _gxl-cell; pressing the right mouse button on any uil-edit-box starts grtl-track-mouse-over-message as the mouse tracks continuously over any uil-edit-box; typing "menu" implies popup-menu.-.-.
set up network access as follows: prohibit connect access by G2 and GSI
clicking the right mouse button on any [class-name] implies popup-menu.-.-. ; double-clicking the left mouse button on any [class-name] implies _keystroke-handler

unless in administrator, developer, or modeler mode: main menu choices exclude absolutely: change-mode; unless in administrator mode: main menu choices exclude absolutely: shut-down-g2, launch-online-help; when in operator or modeler mode: main menu choices exclude absolutely: new-workspace, get-workspace, inspect, system-tables, run-options, change-mode, miscellany, pause, reset, start, resume, restart, save-kb
unless in administrator or developer mode: global keyboard commands exclude absolutely: pause
on pause or reset, only in developer or administrator mode

g2:c.RULE.g2:a.TEXT: initially show console and start reset-console ()

g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.LABEL: MINIMIZE
g2:c.USER-MENU-CHOICE.g2:a.ACTION: in order change the size of the item to minimum and make the item permanent

g2:c.PROCEDURE.g2:a.TEXT: d(msg:text) begin inform the operator for the next 20 seconds that "[msg]"; end

c.HLA-DISPLAY.g2:a.TEXT: C++ S E R V E R S T A T U S
C L I E N T S T A T U S
G2 S E R V E R S T A T U S

g2:c.BORDERLESS-FREE-TEXT.g2:a.TEXT:
This G2 application demonstrates the usage of the G2 HLA package. The application is a client/server simulation package. The G2 client software creates and publishes vehicles with desired initial values and relies on simulation servers to update the vehicle location and fuel level at each clock tick. The client collects and displays the current location and fuel level of each vehicle and acts as a simulation controller. It launches any required process and coordinates the simulation time advance activities.
Client and server communicate via HLA. Simulation servers may either be written in C++ or in G2. This G2 KB includes a simulation server written in G2. Even if the code is located in the same G2 process, the G2 server will communicate with the client through HLA and therefore have its own G2HLA bridge process. It has been kept in the same G2 KB for convenience.

c.UIL-HIDE-BUTTON.ua.LABEL: G2-HLA Demo Information And Source Code

g2:Structure.g2:sa.UIL-BUTTON-LABEL-VALUE: G2-HLA Demo Information And Source Code

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Stop Demo
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: conclude that the _step-demo of ghla-demo-config = true and conclude that the _run-demonstration of ghla-demo-config = false

g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.LABEL: Start Demo
g2:c.ACTION-BUTTON.g2:a.ACTION: in order start reset-console () and start run-demonstration (ghla-demo-config, ghla-demo-client-interface, this window) after 1 second

g2:c.PROCEDURE.g2:a.TEXT: _status-update-msg (msg: text, Win: class ui-client-item) begin if message-board-display is yes then inform the operator that "[msg]"; end

g2:c.RULE.g2:a.TEXT: initially for any a-g2hla-configuration c unconditionally in order conclude that the server-bridge-pid of c = 0.0 and conclude that the client-bridge-pid of c = 0.0 and conclude that the _c-process-pid of c = 0.0 and conclude that the _rtiexec-process-pid of c = 0.0

g2:c.METHOD.g2:a.TEXT: ghla-cb-stop-registration-for-object-class (hla-interface: class g2-interface-to-hla , hla-class-handle: float) begin call _status-update-msg("RTI Client Callback: Stop registration of hla object class with handle [hla-class-handle]'", gfr-default-window); end

ghla-cb-attribute-ownership-acquisition-notification (hla-interface: class g2-interface-to-hla, hla-object-handle: float, hla-attribute-names: class symbol-array) begin call _status-update-msg("RTI Client Callback: Attribute Ownership Acquisition Notification for HLA object '[hla-object-handle]'", gfr-default-window); end

ghla-cb-time-regulation-enabled (hla-interface: class g2-interface-to-hla , federate-time:float) begin call _status-update-msg("RTI Callback: Time regulation enabled. Time: [federate-time]", gfr-default-window); end

ghla-cb-start-registration-for-object-class (hla-interface: class g2-interface-to-hla , hla-class-handle: float ) begin call _status-update-msg("RTI Client Callback: Start registration of hla object class with handle [hla-class-handle]'", gfr-default-window); end

ghla-cb-time-constrained-enabled (hla-interface: class g2-interface-to-hla, federate-time:float) begin call _status-update-msg("RTI Client Callback: Time constrained enabled. Time: [federate-time]", gfr-default-window); end
ghla-cb-time-advance-grant (io: class g2-interface-to-hla, the-time:float) begin end

g2:c.BORDERLESS-FREE-TEXT.g2:a.TEXT: Below are the custom methods for this application.
The following object definition is our HLA interface. It inherits from GHLA-INTERFACE. We will customize some methods of GHLA-INTERFACE for this application.

g2:c.METHOD.g2:a.TEXT: ghla-cb-attribute-ownership-acquisition-notification (hla-interface: class g2-server-test-interface, hla-object-handle: float, hla-attribute-names: class symbol-array) begin call _status-update-msg("RTI Server Callback: Attribute Ownership Acquisition Notification for HLA object '[hla-object-handle]'", gfr-default-window); end
ghla-cb-turn-updates-on-for-object-instance (io: class g2-server-test-interface , hla-object-handle: float, hla-attribute-names: class symbol-array) begin delete hla-attribute-names; end

ghla-cb-stop-registration-for-object-class (hla-interface: class g2-server-test-interface , hla-class-handle: float) begin call _status-update-msg("RTI Server Callback: Stop registration of hla object class with handle [hla-class-handle]'", gfr-default-window); end

ghla-cb-start-registration-for-object-class (hla-interface: class g2-server-test-interface , hla-class-handle: float ) begin call _status-update-msg("RTI Server Callback: Start registration of hla object class with handle [hla-class-handle]'", gfr-default-window); end

ghla-cb-time-constrained-enabled (hla-interface: class g2-server-test-interface , federate-time:float) begin call _status-update-msg("RTI Server Callback: Time constrained enabled. Time: [federate-time]", gfr-default-window); end
ghla-cb-federation-synchronized(hla-interface: class g2-server-test-interface , label: text ) begin end
ghla-cb-synchronization-point-registration-succeeded(hla-interface: class g2-server-test-interface , label: text ) begin end
ghla-cb-time-advance-grant (io: class g2-server-test-interface , the-time:float) begin end

c.GRTL-MODULE-SETTINGS.ua.BACKWARD-COMPATIBILITY-FEATURES: print means print-to-server in configurations, inconsistent behavior of move in configurations, extra vertices in g2-get-connection-vertices
c.GRTL-MODULE-SETTINGS.ua.KB-ITEM-CONFIGURATION: configure the user interface as follows: when in system-administrator or developer mode: pressing alt+the right mouse button implies show-class-definition; when in system-administrator, developer, or modeler mode: pressing control+the right mouse button on any object implies go-to-subworkspace; pressing control+the right mouse button on any kb-workspace implies hide-workspace; pressing shift+the right mouse button on any kb-workspace implies go-to-superior; unless in administrator mode: attributes visible for kb-restrictions exclude: main-menu-user-restrictions, keyboard-command-restrictions, initial-g2-user-mode-for-this-kb; pressing the left mouse button on any bpr-annotation starts grtl-track-mouse-over-message as the mouse tracks continuously over any bpr-annotation; pressing the right mouse button on any _gxl-cell starts grtl-track-mouse-over-message as the mouse tracks continuously over any _gxl-cell; pressing the right mouse button on any uil-edit-box starts grtl-track-mouse-over-message as the mouse tracks continuously over any uil-edit-box; typing "menu" implies popup-menu.-.-.
c.GRTL-MODULE-SETTINGS.ua.KB-ITEM-CONFIGURATION-WHEN-WEB-HOSTED: set up network access as follows: prohibit connect access by G2 and GSI
c.GRTL-MODULE-SETTINGS.ua.KB-ITEM-CONFIGURATION-FOR-CLASSES: clicking the right mouse button on any [class-name] implies popup-menu.-.-. ; double-clicking the left mouse button on any [class-name] implies _keystroke-handler
c.GRTL-MODULE-SETTINGS.ua.KB-MAIN-MENU-USER-RESTRICTIONS: unless in administrator, developer, or modeler mode: main menu choices exclude absolutely: change-mode; unless in administrator mode: main menu choices exclude absolutely: shut-down-g2, launch-online-help; when in operator or modeler mode: main menu choices exclude absolutely: new-workspace, get-workspace, inspect, system-tables, run-options, change-mode, miscellany, pause, reset, start, resume, restart, save-kb
c.GRTL-MODULE-SETTINGS.ua.KB-KEYBOARD-COMMAND-RESTRICTIONS: unless in administrator or developer mode: global keyboard commands exclude absolutely: pause
c.GRTL-MODULE-SETTINGS.ua.KB-AUTOMATICALLY-SHOW-DEVELOPER-MENU-: on pause or reset, only in developer or administrator mode
